column4: Ok, the long and short of it is this:  I may have installed the incorrect display drivers in ubuntu.  I just updated them and now I get a garbled mess when the system boots.
man, my intertubes are being real flaky tonight
What do I do?  I can't get into ubuntu now.
What display driver did you install?
ATI Radeon HD2400
which the spec sheet says is what my comp has
Jordan:  At grub, there is an option to go into recovery mode
assuming that works, then what?
I dual boot vista, so I can't have both open at the same time
Jack:  I would have no idea what to do once I get a terminal open
How do I revert back to what I had before?
Wiseman2 Ctrl-Alt-F6
login with your user name and password
I'm not sure that helps me if I can't see the terminal
sudo rm /etc/X11/xorg.conf
well I get internet through wireless, which is through NDISWRAPPER.  Would i have that if I boot into this recovery mode?
Ctrl-Alt-F6  Login with user name and password.  suod rm /etc/X11/xorg.conf
What's xorg?
that's not gonna screw anything up?
....worse than it already is?
Nope
